page.title: 08Transport
page.content: Communications are excellent. There is a{railway}station on the main Birmingham-London line,and it is used extensively by commuters.There is close access to the{M42}which is being extended to the{M5}with exits at Shirley and in the other direction the National Exhibition Centre. We are only ten minutes drive from Birmingham International{Airport}with flights all over Europe and a few to America. A regular{bus service}(182,159,152 and 149) runs through the area and links up with rail services. They usually run from Solihull Station to Dorridge Station via Knowle. Dorridge is situated between the main Birmingham - Warwick and Birmingham - Stratford{roads.}This makes road travel to Birmingham and The South of England easy.
